glsa.title: socat: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in socat might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: socat is a multipurpose bidirectional relay, similar to netcat.

description.p: A vulnerability in the "xioscan_readline()" function in xio-readline.c could cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the socat process.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All socat users should upgrade to the latest version:
